summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from December 2020 discussing a potential new client for victim services. The emails involve FBI personnel in New York and the Victim Services Division coordinating approval for therapy for an individual identified as a confirmed victim of Jeffrey Epstein. A licensed psychotherapist from Florida initiated the contact.

persons.name: M.S.
persons.context: A licensed mental health counselor certified in sexual abuse trauma from Greenacres, Florida, who reached out to the FBI to inform them they would begin treating an individual for victimization by Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'Mr. Epstein,' identified as the perpetrator of the victimization for which the individual is seeking therapy.

connections.description: M.S. is a therapist providing treatment to a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled therapy session for Epstein victim
events.description: A licensed psychotherapist scheduled to begin treatment for an individual regarding her victimization by Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Therapist contacts FBI about new client
events.description: A licensed psychotherapist emails the FBI to inform them an individual reached out for therapy related to Epstein victimization.

events.title: FBI internal discussion on victim services approval
events.description: FBI personnel in New York and the Victim Services Division exchange emails to confirm victim status and approve counseling for an individual.

keyFacts: An individual identified as a confirmed victim of Jeffrey Epstein was seeking therapy through the FBI's victim services program in late 2020.
Internal FBI emails show coordination between the New York field office and the Victim Services Division to approve and understand the counseling case.
A licensed psychotherapist from Florida was scheduled to begin treatment for the victim on December 8, 2020.
